name: Google Mail
desc: Google Gmail now supports the standard IMAP and SMTP protocols for accessing and sending e-mail messages. The Gmail IMAP and SMTP servers have been extended to support authorization via the industry-standard OAuth protocol. This allows third party applications to access a user's email account with their permission.

values.https://mail.google.com/: The scope for IMAP and SMTP access
values.email: Get access to your mail. The presence of email requests that the ID Token include email and email_verified claims, and that these values be included in the information available at the userinfo endpoint.
values.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.mo: All read/write operations except immediate, permanent deletion of threads and messages, bypassing Trash.
values.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.re: Read all resources and their metadataâ€”no write operations.
values.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.co: Create, read, update, and delete drafts. Send messages and drafts.
values.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/plus.log: Know your name, basic info, and list of people you're connected to on Google+
values.profile: Get access to your profile. profile will provide an Access Token that can be used to obtain user profile information from the Userinfo endpoint. We recommend using Google+ Sign-In if your application needs user profile information because the Google+ APIs provide a richer set of data that can be controlled by the user
